title: Subdomain takeover : URGENT

profile.name: KIWI.KI GmbH
profile.about: KIWI.KI provides secure, hands-free access for large multi-tenant buildings.

vulnerability_information:
hi,

one of your subdomain is pointing to FRESHDESK but servicce is expire there,
so i can claim this http://service.kiwi.ki/  subdomain.

Fix: remove dns entry of  this subdomain asap




Thanks
vulnerability_information_html:
hi,

one of your subdomain is pointing to FRESHDESK but servicce is expire there,
so i can claim this http://service.kiwi.ki/ subdomain.

Fix: remove dns entry of this subdomain asap

Thanks

activities.message:
Hi!

Thanks for your report. We've recieved a huge number of reports from the results of automated scanners--we're going through each one and are composing full replies.

Our website, analytics, CRM, and other systems are out of scope for our bounty program. They are parts of our "corporate website". There is no connectivity between our web server and our production systems, so the risk of exposure here is relatively low. 

Just as a reminder, here are the four areas which our bounty program is targeted:
* Ki (Hardware)
* Wireless (Protocol)
* API (Server, api.kiwi.ki)
* Mobile (Web Application, mobile.kiwi.ki)

Cheers,
Jeff Katz
VP Engineering
activities.markdown_message:
Hi!

Thanks for your report. We've recieved a huge number of reports from the results of automated scanners--we're going through each one and are composing full replies.

Our website, analytics, CRM, and other systems are out of scope for our bounty program. They are parts of our "corporate website". There is no connectivity between our web server and our production systems, so the risk of exposure here is relatively low.

Just as a reminder, here are the four areas which our bounty program is targeted:

  • Ki (Hardware)
  • Wireless (Protocol)
  • API (Server, api.kiwi.ki)

activities.message:
Hi Paresh,

The line about the scanner is so that you understand I am having to triage > 300 reports, mostly generated with automated scanners. 

The second part is perhaps more important--the scope of our bounty program does not cover DNS, our main website, or other things hosted on various KIWI domains. 

Regards,
Jeff
activities.markdown_message:

The line about the scanner is so that you understand I am having to triage > 300 reports, mostly generated with automated scanners.

The second part is perhaps more important--the scope of our bounty program does not cover DNS, our main website, or other things hosted on various KIWI domains.

Regards,
Jeff

@kraln Completly agree with you decision regarding your program policy!
but you should consider reports as severity of issue!!
like this issue! this domain is use for fool your customer to steal login details, and other .

activities.message:
@paresh_parmar 
I have been considering reports outside of the scope of our program; I will raise this issue internally and see if we cannot find an amicable resolution.

Regards,
Jeff
activities.markdown_message:
@paresh_parmar
I have been considering reports outside of the scope of our program; I will raise this issue internally and see if we cannot find an amicable resolution.

Regards,

activities.message:
Hello @paresh_parmar,

We have removed the offending DNS entry. We can of course disclose publically and give thanks--we are discussing internally if it is severe enough (at our current stage) and close enough to our desired scope--which did not include DNS/server configuration-- to merit a bounty. 

Curious to hear your thoughts,
Jeff
activities.markdown_message:

Curious to hear your thoughts,

summaries.content: KIWI had been trialing the use of FreshDesk internally, and had left a DNS entry pointed to their services which subsequently was out of control of KIWI. This could have been used to confuse or trick KIWI customers.
summaries.content_html: KIWI had been trialing the use of FreshDesk internally, and had left a DNS entry pointed to their services which subsequently was out of control of KIWI. This could have been used to confuse or trick KIWI customers.
